task.title: NCSU Discussion Boards and checking your grades in Wolfware
task.shortdesc: From Wolfware you are able to submit a forum to a discussion board and check your grades

taskbody.context:
Students can post to a discussion board through Wolfware, under a current course that they are taking
Context of the course and discussion boards are subject to change.

step.cmd: Post an replyto a discussion board
When looking through assignments for the class, sometimes you will have to work through discussion boards to conversate with the class online.
Below is a sample of what you might see if you were to have this an as assignment.
Fromthe initial discussion board buttonyou would click on the assignment and read over whatever prompt is requested.
If you are the first to create a post you will see the image to the right of the screen.
If you arent the first to post you will be prompted to add an additional post to the forums.
No matter the situation, once you click add discussion you will see the image below

Based on the prompt that is required, you would fill out both the subject and message boxes to fit the assignment.
Simply click on the post to forum when you want to submit what text is in the box and your work will be posted to the discussion

taskbody.context:
Students can check their grades in Wolfware
From the Wolfware homepage you can check your current course grades.

step.cmd: It's important to make sure to check your current grades onwolfware to keep track of your assignment participation and fulfullments.

Below is a sample of what the Wolfware homepage looks like
Under current click on one of the listed classes
Fromthe initial discussion board buttonyou would click on the assignment and read over whatever prompt is requested.
If you are the first to create a post you will see the image to the right of the screen.

Whether you click on a class and end up on that specific page or somehow get placed onto the main dashboard
you will still have access to your grades
Once on the Wolfware dashboard, clicking on the upside down triangle will make the image below pop up.
Once clicking on the 'grades' section you will be brought to the screen below

If the grade is not shown on the main page, simply click on the course that you would want to see the grade of.
It's important to note that some grades may not appear due to the teacher's preference for grading.
